text: Jonathan Haidt is an American psychologist who writes about the psychology of morality. == Books == * 2006. The Happiness Hypothesis: Finding Modern Truth in Ancient Wisdom. Basic Books. . * 2012. The Righteous Mind: Why Good People Are Divided by Politics and Religion. Pantheon. . * 2018. The Coddling of the American Mind: How Good Intentions and Bad Ideas Are Setting Up a Generation for Failure, co-written with Greg Lukianoff. New York City: Penguin Press. . . * 2024. The Anxious Generation: How the Great Rewiring of Childhood Is Causing an Epidemic of Mental Illness. Penguin. . == References == Category:Living people Category:American psychologists
